author: sabrinaliu47
title: Cardano Hub TAIWAN
description: The Cardano community in Taiwan is limited, and most people, especially university students, have little knowledge about crypto or Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0: The team proposes to host educational workshops to address the problem of low awareness of Cardano in the area, this is totally aligned with the objective of this challenge. Taiwain has a population of about 24m people (according to https://www.worldometers.info/) a number that might seem low compared to some other areas, but I think the economic potential compensates it. What I find especially interesting is that the focus of the proposal is to present it in Universities, where we can usually find people with potential affinity with Cardano. When I wanted to analyze the metrics to corroborate the alignment with the metrics of the challenge I could only find the number of attendees expected in the different workshops, and although I consider it a necessary metric for this type of proposal, it is necessary to complement it with other traceable metrics that show that this attendance would be effectively converted into new users, new proposals, new SPOs perhaps? I recommend the team to think from that side the focus of the proposal to make it more robust and with better opportunities for funding allocation. I have decided to give it a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q1: When evaluating the profile of the team in charge of the implementation of this proposal I can only find details of merit of what appears to be only one person, no additional reference information is presented to support their arguments. Regarding the budget and implementation plan, as it is a relatively simple proposal with no complex steps, the information needed to make an accurate assessment. The budget is appropriate and is in compliance with the requirement of not exceeding 5% of the challenge budget. Regarding the risks, it raises the situation of restrictions associated with the COVID, as a counterproposal they propose the possibility of doing it online, another possibility that could be considered are open or semi-closed spaces. Another relevant risk that should have been taken into account is a high dropout rate, to which I would expect countermeasures to have been thought of as well. On a general level, and considering the amount requested, I agree with this proposal from a feasibility point of view.
f6_assessments.q2: To ensure the auditability of this proposal, the team proposes the creation of a group of cha and registration through workshops, to which I would recommend adding some complementary measure that allows you to record the level of attendance which can be consulted by the community in general. The only metric included is the level of attendance at events. This metric is of course necessary for this type of proposals, but I would recommend adding metrics such as number of proposals in Catalyst as a result of these events, new wallets for events, among others. After what has been described, I have decided to score this section with 3.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal meets the challenge's requirements.  The problem is clearly stated as well as its solution. The proposer is a young daring person willing to make the Cardano community known in Taiwan and specifically among university students.  The influence of the proposal on cardano ecosystem is direct and hopefully it will increase Cardano users in Taiwan.  I find extremely challenging and promising the fact that the target population are young people.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer is using her position to influence people which is very clever of her. She also has some experience in organizing events.  I am not sure though how a one person team can run 12 live meetings. The team members are not clearly stated in the proposal therefore, I can only assume that she will call in people for assistance. The total budget is reasonable for the activity the proposer is planning, although there is some overlapping of expenses (e.g. co-working space fee, food, drinks and meet-up logistics, venue costs).  Furthermore, the proposer refers to $1200 – ADA giveaway but she does not give further explanation, therefore it can only be assumed that she will give away ada as incentive to attend the meetings?  
The proposer has taken into consideration the covid situation and the risk of not performing the events in person.  She suggested that in such a case, then the events will take place online.  I am not sure how successful the project will be if it's performed online that is, if the number of participants will be as anticipated.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has give a clear road map and KPIs based on that. It is not clear though how the proposer will inform the Cardano community of the success of the project in regards to the actual numbers of attendees, and how the community can track the success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal aligns with the challenge in a number of ways. 1. the hub will serve as a important information delivery node to the average person (students) who would otherwise not hear about Cardano 2. The target audience will be reached within their cultural context and language 3. It responds to the MVH concept and involves little capital to start 4. It has the ultimate goal of increasing growth and integrating people into the Cardano ecosystem. 

THe proposal however did not touch on scalability and sustainability in the long term. Proposers could provide additional information to cover these 2 areas in order to improve their rating for impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
THe broad framework of objectives to be achieved has been provided to cover a 12 month period and it is anticipated that monthly events or workshop will be held throughout this duration. There are however no actionable tasks giving a proper breakdown of the event planning process. A little more detail on the content of the events will also give a better understanding of how the proposer intends to deliver Cardano related information ie through networking events, presentations, discussions or use of prerecorded videos etc. 

The budget corresponds with the implementation plan in terms of items budgeted for however "co-working space" has been budgeted for although the proposal does not discuss anything relating to co-working spaces. Some clarification is required. The main risk identified is that of the resurgence of covid 19 and to mitigate, meetings will be convened online.

This is a sole member team with experience in organising university events and is Co-SPO for DOG Pool with strong relations with other Cardano industry professionals. (Link provided). An additional team member will enhance the planning and implementation of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: There are key milestones for the 3, 6 and 12 month mark and metrics are provided to support auditability. The metrics show an anticipated growth of 100 students per event at the end of the project from a baseline of less than 30. A means of updating the community on the progress of wok will improve the auditability rating of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0: Strong communities are critical because they're often an important source of social connection and a sense of belonging. Participating in a community bonded by attitudes, values, and goals is an essential ingredient to enjoying a fulfilling life. The proposer wants to host a Cardano Hub in National Chengchi University in Taipei providing educational workshops to students which will help students gain more knowledge and basics of Cardano which will also be an opportunity for the students to get into Cardano and work for it which is going to benefit everyone in the society. The proposer has identified a need for making community hubs as social impact organization and they have also worked towards the implementation which is impressive and it will attract a lot of people to get involved in this and hence increase the popularity and face value of the cardano ecosystem. The proposer has also mentioned the key metrics which will be helpful in the success of this proposal. The proposer has already pointed out the challenges they will be facing and also has alternate solutions to the challenges and the challenges can be scalable.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has a very innovative idea of introducing Cardona Hub in Taiwan and has also provided referral links to provide evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal and his team seems to be very well versed in many of the topics required to implement the proposal. The budget is outlined clearly and is broken down into identifiable items which seems to be fair and is reasonable. The proposer has already pointed out the challenges they will be facing and also has alternate solutions to the challenges and the challenges can be scalable. By the given experience and the plan for the proposal is more likely to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has a very well planned roadmap to achieve the proposal. The proposer has request funds of 9780 USD and also given the breakup cost of all the identifiable items which seems fair and is reasonable to achieve the goal. Proposer has identified a real world requirement, understood it and is working towards a solution to solve the problem and the provided information is sufficient to audit the progress. The expertise and the knowledge from the proposer and his team and the implementation of the plan is more likely to succeed.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal goes directly to the students of the university where the proposer is studying. The proposer will hold 12 face-to-face meetings during a year. 
In her country when people think about crypto which mostly would be the btc or eth etc.  So the public of Cardano still occupies very little space.  That's why I think this idea coincides with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan has a good possibility of execution considering the propser has excellent previous experience of organizing events at her university and she is Co Spo of Dog Pool which has good relations with other cardano industry professionals .  The number of participants that detailed in the plan that willing to reach in each period sounds reasonable.  Also the budge does not seem to be exaggerated  'cause that would be for the 12 meetings.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer would create a group chat about cardano hub to upload event information and photos.  This makes it easier ro review the proposal' results and whether the number of people mentioned in the plan has been reached.  So I believe the monitorability is quite good.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal effectively addresses the challenge. Taiwan is a technologically advanced country, not many people know and hold CARDANO, so there is a great need for this kind of event to promote CARDANO, students in Taiwan also lack understanding of cryptocurrency, holding an event in a university will definitely attract many college students to participate and understand CARDANO, so I think this is a great idea and iniciative and very much support this project. As one of the most important technological countries, the country of Chips. Taiwan needs this kind of events.
f6_assessments.q1: Looking at her past experience, videos and photos, you can see that she has participated in many large events, in addition to pageants, she has also served as a volunteer, exchange student and participated in auditions, she must have a clear understanding of the process of the event, and you can tell from the video that she will not get stage fright at the event. This is also one of the very important character traits of a host, Asians are shy, so some people are reluctant to speak or perform in front of the public, you can see that she can easily grasp the scene and can speak in front of many people, she hopes to organize 12 presential events with high feasibility, very encouraging
f6_assessments.q2: We can audit the success of the events by video, photos, number of applicants and number of participants. So it´s completely auditable!

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is short and straight to the point and it also included all the information needed to be successfully implemented. I give it a good rating on its impact because it is in the scope of this challenge. Building a hub targeting students in Taiwan can add value to the cardano ecosystem and participate in cardano global adoption. I think that the proposer has done a great job explaining the goal of this proposal and the key metrics they will look for.
f6_assessments.q1: I think that the proposal can have a high score on feasibility based on the information included in this proposal. They have provided a roadmap with milestones to complete the work. I think that the proposer knows exactly what they are trying to build and the results they are expecting in the timeframe that they have defined. The only improvement that I see is to give more information on the team needed to complete the work. The proposer has provided a video and a photo that showcase her experiences, but I think that a linkedin profile can work better. Other than that, I think that the proposers should be able to deliver on their promesses.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal contains all the information that can help track its progress. The proposers have provided a roadmap with milestones and timeframes for achievements. I think that they have done a good job including strong KPIs. However I recommend to the proposers to add a marketing strategy and to build a social media following that will allow them to interact with their community. Other than that, I think that the proposal can be easily audited.

solution: Host a Cardano Hub in National Chengchi University in Taipei providing educational workshops to students.
experience:
Student at National Chengchi University

Miss Asia 2020 of Intelligence

Volunteering in 2019 Overseas Youth English Service Camp Zhongshan Elementary School

Participate in AFS exchanging program in Ounsdale High school in 2018

Finalist at SM Entertainment audition 2017
